channel.title: Blog on Tamas Gal
channel.description: Recent content in Blog on Tamas Gal

item.title: Killed 9
item.description:
I am a big fan of the game K240 which I played a lot with my step brother back in the 90ies on an Amiga Commodore 500. There is a standalone application for macOS provided by “Games Nostalgia” which bundles the game and the Amiga emulator FS-UAE and works out of the box.

Unfortunately, on my new M1 MacBook it did not start up correctly, instead I got a very generic “Killed: 9” error:

item.title: RAID Monitor for LSI/3Ware MegaRAID controllers
item.description:
I still manage a few old servers with 3Ware/LSI MegaRAID controllers (e.g. the 9650SE) and wrote the following Python3 script which is sitting in /etc/cron.daily and sends and email if there is any problem with the battery, disks or units. Keep in mind that scripts inside the /etc/cron.* folders are not allowed to have a dot in the filename, otherwise those will be ignored.

If you don’t have a working mail configuration, I recommend exim4 which is easily set up in a few minutes with standard settings.

item.title: Data Exchange Between Python and C++ via protobuf
item.description: An example how to use Googles protobuf to send a data structure from a C++ script to a Python script via UDP.
